30 Vita sancti vincent Vincent ij Mart&ydot;ris.
SEint Vincent
In in spa&ydot;ne &punctelev; to a cri&slong;tine bischop cam
Þat men cleopeden valentin Valentin &punctelev; and cri&slong;tindom of him nam
Þe king of þe londe &punctelev; Dacian was is name
Fo&rrot; þe bischop cri&slong;tine was &punctelev; he þouȝte to don him schame
he let him nime and binde &punctelev; and don him in grete pine
Þe bischop cride ȝerne on god God &punctelev; he nolde oþur fine
With heom þat him to&rrot;menteden &punctelev; he spac with milde speche
Seint Vincent was þarefo&rrot;e wrath &punctelev; and seide ich mot þe teche
Ȝw&ydot; spext þov so mildeliche &punctelev; ase þei þov ad&rrot;ad were
Wen&slong;tþou þat heo þine Mai&slong;tres maistres beon &punctelev; ȝwarof haue&slong;t þov fere
Spec hardiliche and confo&rrot;te wel &punctelev; oþure þat cri&slong;tine beoth
Þat heo mowe to þe deþe hardie beon &punctelev; ase heo þe iseoth
hov is þis" seide þe king &punctelev; ȝweþur þes þef wene fiȝte
And withsegge us al ab&rrot;od &punctelev; Ich him schal euene diȝte
Lateth þene bischop awei gon &punctelev; fo&rrot; is milde speche
Nimez vincent Vincent and bindez anon &punctelev; we schullen him oþur tech[e]
With scourges and with &slong;taues &punctelev; fa&slong;te ȝe him bete
Þat he ne mouw iwielde neuere a lime &punctelev; are þat ȝe him lete
Ȝe seide vincent Vincent þov paiȝe&slong;t me wel &punctelev; þi wo&rrot;d ne þinchez me nouȝt ille
Ine fond neuere Man man þat so wel &punctelev; aco&rrot;dede to mi wille
¶Nov ich hopie to habbe game &punctelev; fo&rrot; ero&rrot;e me þouȝte longe
hit schal me tu&ydot;rne to Io&ydot;e ioye and gleo &punctelev; and þe to[MS. to þe] pines &slong;tronge
Þe to&rrot;mento&rrot;es nomen þane holie Man man &punctelev; and to a piler him bounde
With &slong;taues and scourges heo leiden on him[al. him on] &punctelev; and maden him mani a wounde
Þo heo ȝeuen him so&rrot;e&slong;t duntes &punctelev; leiȝen he gan wel smere
Þe to&rrot;mento&rrot;es seten adoun and cleopeden help &punctelev; þo heo werie were
And seiden &punctelev; we beoth nouþe ouercome &punctelev; o&rrot;e Armes armes aketh so&rrot;e
he[l]pez us and betez þesne[MS. þesne þesne] þeof &punctelev; fo&rrot; we ne mowen non[MS. nou] mo&rrot;e
Þo was þe king wroth with heom &punctelev; he let heom anou take
Some he let to&rrot;menti so&rrot;e &punctelev; þat ech bon heom gan Ake ake
And some he let to deþe b&rrot;ingue &punctelev; and some in oþur turment
Euere he let ferschi and nevn&ydot;[r. nevu&ydot;] &punctelev; to&rrot;mento&rrot;es to seint Vincent
Ȝwane heo weren werie of bete &punctelev; þe holi man bigan to speke
Louerd iwu&ydot;rþed beo þi name &punctelev; nouþe ich am swiþe wel awreke
Þe mo&rrot;e þat heo betez me &punctelev; þe betere me is iwis
to heom i[t] to&rrot;neþ to pine and so&rrot; &punctelev; and me to Ioie and blis
¶Ne mowe we novȝt seide þe king &punctelev; with noþing þarto it b&rrot;inge
Þat þov nelt nemme þine false god &punctelev; fo&rrot; no luþur betinge
Þov luþere Man man " seide Vincent &punctelev; ȝeot þou mo&slong;t to&rrot;menti mo&rrot;e
Ine habbe nouȝt ȝeot to&rrot;menz inouwe &punctelev; þarafter me longez so&rrot;e
Þo he was iscourget so &punctelev; þat men miȝten iseo ech bon
And euerech Io&ydot;nt ioynt and senue &punctelev; þe king gan ner him gon
Vincent he seide haue of þiself &punctelev; revþe and merci
Ne lat þov nonmo&rrot;e þi fa[i]re bodi &punctelev; þus defouli
bilief on ovre gode&slong; Godes and to&rrot;ne anon &punctelev; þi þouȝt and þi mod
And ischal þe ȝiue ope al mi lond &punctelev; pouwer gret and guod
beo &slong;tille seide seint Seint
vincent Vincent &punctelev; al Atter atter is þi lo&rrot;e
beo &slong;tille anon þou deueles tonge &punctelev; þou make&slong;t me d&rrot;ede so&rrot;e
hit me greueth þat þov feine&slong;t þe &punctelev; mo&rrot;e þane al þe pine
And alle þe to&rrot;mens þat þov me de&slong;t &punctelev; þov and alle þine
Þat þov bileue&slong;t þine to&rrot;menz so sone &punctelev; and art bineoþe ib&rrot;ouȝt
Ȝeot þou mo&slong;t mo&rrot;e Io&ydot;e ioye &punctelev; b&rrot;ingen in mi þouȝt
Þov schalt ȝeot seide þe king &punctelev; mo to&rrot;menz afonge
he let him lede withoute þe toun &punctelev; and on a gibet him honge
Vincent fo&rrot; Ioie ioie bigan to eo&rrot;ne &punctelev; þo he iheo&rrot;de þis dom
Þare nas non þat him miȝte ouertake &punctelev; are he to þe gibat com
Þo þat he anhengut was &punctelev; gret Io&ydot;e ioye he made and blisse
Euere he p&rrot;echede ase he heng &punctelev; gode&slong; Godes wo&rrot;des to wisse
Þe lengo&rrot;e þat he þare heng &punctelev; þe mo&rrot;e Ioie he made
Þo gradden þe to&rrot;mento&rrot;es &punctelev; we ne schullen neuere ouercome þis tade
¶Atþe la&slong;te he nomen him adoun &punctelev; and ladden bifo&rrot;e þe kinge
And seiden þat heo ne miȝten him &punctelev; fo&rrot; noþing to deþe b&rrot;inge
Alas seide þe king þo &punctelev; is o&rrot;e miȝte us binome
Ȝwareof seruieth ovre gode&slong; Godes &punctelev; þat þes þeof us schal ouercome
Ledez him withoute þe toun &punctelev; a gret fu&ydot;r ȝe þare make
And þat he beo amidde ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; and ibounde to one &slong;take
Fo&rrot;b&rrot;enne he schal euerech lime &punctelev; ne schal he þus him wer[e]
And ȝwane he is to dou&slong;te Ibarnd &punctelev; we beoth ib&rrot;ouȝt of care
Þe to&rrot;mento&rrot;es nomen seint Seint
Vincent &punctelev; and duden þe kingus he&slong;te
Þe holi man wende into þe fu&ydot;r &punctelev; ase gladliche ase to one fe&slong;te
Þo heo wenden þat seint vincent Vincent &punctelev; to dou&slong;te ib&rrot;end were
heo o&rrot;nen hom and tolden þe kinge fo&rrot;e &punctelev; gladdo&rrot;e neuere heo nere
heo ne miȝten so sone hom come &punctelev; þat seint vincent Vincent nas er
At home and &slong;tod bifo&rrot;e þe kinge &punctelev; mani so&rrot;i man was þer
¶Þe to&rrot;mento&rrot;es tolden þe kingue &punctelev; hov he ibarnd was
Alas alas" þe king seide &punctelev; neuerer ischend inas
Schal þeos þef us ouercome &punctelev; Mahun nou þin o&rrot;e
Þei he grete to&rrot;menz habbe ihaued &punctelev; ȝeot ich can biþenche mo&rrot;e
he let nime platus of Ire ire &punctelev; sumdel þunne and b&rrot;ode
And let heom legge amidde þe place &punctelev; wel neiȝ ane cartes lode
gret fu&ydot;r he let þaron make &punctelev; and þo heo glowinde were
Þat wodefu&ydot;r heo duden al awei &punctelev; þane guode man þudere heo bere
And on þe berninde plates him ca&slong;ten &punctelev; and some þarof heo toke
And leiden anouewarde is holi bodi &punctelev; mid one Irene croke
Al he was þaron ihud &punctelev; þe ȝut nadde he none fere
Þat grece of him o&rrot;n ab&rrot;od &punctelev; ase þei it frijnge were
Þe sw&ydot;þere þat he barnde &punctelev; þe gladdo&rrot;e he him made
he louȝ smere ȝwane þe plates &punctelev; In is flesch gonne wade
Atþe biginningue he was glad &punctelev; and gladdo&rrot;e atþenende
Alas alas þe king seide þo &punctelev; þes þef us wole schende
Þis to&rrot;ment ne helpez us nouȝt &punctelev; anoþur we moten biþenche
he let maken a sw&ydot;þe gret fu&ydot;r &punctelev; þat noþing ne miȝte aquenche
¶Seint Vincent hu&ydot; lei[den] amidewarde &punctelev; and sethþe salt heo nome
And Mid ladeles on is wondene it ca&slong;ten &punctelev; in[al. & in] þe fu&ydot;r ilome
So þat þe salt scholde is woundene frete &punctelev; with þe b&rrot;enninde fu&ydot;re
Þe sp&rrot;anglinge of þe blode iselt &punctelev; wide men miȝten ihu&ydot;re
Ȝe" seide þis guode man &punctelev; þis is a swete fe&slong;te
Mani Io&ydot;e ioye ichabbe ihaued &punctelev; ake þis is on þe me&slong;te
Ȝwane is blod sp&rrot;einde In in þe rof an heiȝ &punctelev; he gan to leiȝen smere
Þanne was þe king and alle is men &punctelev; In sw&ydot;þe grete fere
And seiden &punctelev; þes þef us wole ouercome. &punctelev; Mahun ȝware is þi miȝte
Schal þes þef with is wichchinge &punctelev; aȝen þi power fiȝte
Ȝeot Ich þenche seide þe king &punctelev; of one pine &slong;tronge
beo þes þef þaron ido &punctelev; he ne schal nouȝt libbe longe
heo setten him in a sw&ydot;þe deo&rrot;k put &punctelev; þat in þe ga&ydot;hole was
So ful of sweo&rrot;des pointes ipiȝte &punctelev; ase Mede is ful of gras
Þareoppe þanne holi man &punctelev; heo ca&slong;ten fa&slong;te ibounde
Þat þe pointes of þe swerdes scholden &punctelev; ȝiuen him deþes woundes
Fa&slong;te heo loken alle þe do&rrot;e &punctelev; and leten him longe þere beo
Ope þe swerdes pointes in deo&rrot;khede &punctelev; he ne miȝte noþing iseo
Þare cam an Aungel aungel with a taper &punctelev; b&rrot;enninde in is hond
Of his pine he bar him op &punctelev; and þare was gode&slong; Godes sonde
¶Þe Aungel aungel was þar with him &punctelev; ase longe ase he þare was
Mid a b&rrot;enninde taper and Ioie gret &punctelev; þat neuere mo&rrot;e nas
Þo it was longe þareafturward &punctelev; þis men comen þerbiside
And wende þat he were ded &punctelev; ane &slong;tounde heo gonne abide
Þo iheo&rrot;den heo þis holi man &punctelev; loude and murie singe
And herede god God in heuene. &punctelev; heo tolden þat þe kinge
Þo was þe þing neiȝ iswowe &punctelev; and seide sichinde wel so&rrot;e
Alas we beoth nouþe ouercome &punctelev; Ine can[MS. cam] þenche non mo&rrot;e
Ovre gode&slong; Godes ne helpez us nouȝt &punctelev; þat alle þing habbeth to wolde
Inelle neuereeft aȝein him fiȝte &punctelev; creaunt ichulle me holde
¶Ȝwane no pine ne mai him sle &punctelev; oþur þing ichulle fonde
goth he seide and maketh a bed &punctelev; þat softe&slong;te in anie londe
Of quoiltene and of materasz &punctelev; of cheisel and of palle
And þanne leggez him þaron &punctelev; swiþe softe withalle
Þo þat bed was imaket &punctelev; to þe ga&ydot;hole heo wende
And founden þare þat lijȝt of heuene &punctelev; þat o&rrot;e louerd þudere sende
Wel softe heo nomen þis holi man &punctelev; and cu&slong;ten is so&rrot;e wounden
to Relikes heo gadereden &slong;tilleliche &punctelev; þat heo of is blode founden
heo leiden him in þat nesche bed &punctelev; and þo he was þaron
his p&rrot;eiere he dude to o&rrot;e louerd cri&slong;t &punctelev; and deide þo anon
Þo þe king isaiȝ þis þat he deide &punctelev; so mildeliche in is bedde
to&rrot;menz he seide we him habbeth ido &punctelev; vuele þarof us spedde
Ded we wolleth him ouercome &punctelev; ȝwane we ne miȝten aliue
Into þe wilde felde &punctelev; þat bodi ȝe beren wel bliue
Wilde be&slong;tes and foules &punctelev; tod&rrot;awe heo schullen it sone
Þis men b&rrot;ouȝten þat bodi þare &punctelev; and duden þe kingus bone
Þare cam fleo a Rauon rauon &punctelev; and adoun þarebi he aliȝte
Kene and su&ydot;þe d&rrot;edful &punctelev; iredi he was to fiȝte
ȝif þare come ani foul to &punctelev; þat þis bodi iseiȝe
Þe Rauon rauon smot to grounde &punctelev; ne mo&slong;ten þare come non neiȝe
¶Ake Euere euere he d&rrot;of heom awei &punctelev; þudere ȝwane heo come
Ne miȝte þare come none so kene &punctelev; þat o mossel þarof nome
A wolf cam also þuderward &punctelev; is mete fo&rrot;to fette
And wolde of þat bodi nime. &punctelev; þe Rauon rauon aȝein him sette
he flev and smot with bile and fot &punctelev; þat þe wolf atþen ende
blodi was and ouercome &punctelev; aȝen hamward he gan wende
Þe Rauon rauon wu&slong;te þis bodi longe &punctelev; Iwemmed nouȝt it nas
Þo þe king it onderȝat &punctelev; þat þe bodi ihol was
hom he let it fette aȝen &punctelev; and seide ȝwat ma&ydot; beo ovre red
þat we ne mouwen him ouercome &punctelev; noþer quik ne ded
Ȝif we ne mouwen quik ne ded &punctelev; ouercome him alonde
Fo&rrot; no[MS. ne] quo&ydot;ntise þat we mouwen do &punctelev; awatere we wollez fonde
he let it lede fer into þe se &punctelev; and bonde þarto mani a &slong;ton
And ca&slong;ten it out of a schip &punctelev; it bigan to sinke anon
þo þe Mariners mariners iseien þis &punctelev; glade heo weren and bliþe
Fo&rrot;to telle þe kinge fo&rrot;e &punctelev; heo hiȝeden hom wel bliue
heo ne miȝten so sone to londe come &punctelev; þat heo ne founden alonde
Þis holi Man man wel faire ligge &punctelev; abouen þe sesonde
So&rrot;e agremed and aschamed &punctelev; hom hu&ydot; gonne wende
Þe kinge heo tolden al heo&rrot;e cas &punctelev; fram þe fur&slong;te to þe ende
Alas alas þe king seide &punctelev; þe schame and þe schonde
We ne mowe him neuere ouercome &punctelev; quik ne ded awatere ne alonde
¶Do we him out of ovre þouȝt &punctelev; we ne mouwen us neuere awreke
... .. .. 30 93
Ich d&rrot;ede þat he mi bane wo&rrot;þe &punctelev; Ihere ihere ich mo&rrot;e of him &slong;peke
Aniȝt In in slepe seint Seint
Vincent cam &punctelev; to A a womman þarebi&slong;ide
And tolde hire ȝware is bodi lai &punctelev; and bad hire nouȝt to longe abide
Ake þat heo it scholde burie &slong;one &punctelev; fo&rrot; him longuede after re&slong;te
Þi&slong; guode womman it onder&slong;tod &punctelev; þo heo awok with þe be&slong;te
heo wende and &slong;ouȝte þis holi bodi &punctelev; and fond it &slong;wiþe &slong;one
heo dude it burie with gret honour &punctelev; a&slong;e riȝt was fo&rrot;to done
Þus seint Seint
vincent Vincent þe holie man &punctelev; in Spa&ydot;ne Spayne endede is lif
And wende to þe bli&slong;&slong;e of heuene &punctelev; after þi&slong; pine&slong; and &slong;trif
Men nu&slong;ten neuere mart&ydot;&rrot; non &punctelev; þat hadde mo&rrot;e to&rrot;ment
Ne þat with &slong;om pine ouercome na&slong; &punctelev; bote þe gode man &slong;eint Seint
vincent Vincent
